axes(size=10, width=500, 'px', height=300, 'px')¶

Usage:

svg = rptObj.ui.charts.svg.axes()

m = svg.defs().marker(“circle”, “0 0 10 10”, 5, 5) m.circle(5, 5, 5, ‘red’) m.markerWidth(10).markerHeight(10) p = svg.path(0, 0, from_origin=True).line_to(50, 100).horizontal_line_to(300).line_to(400, 200) p.markers(m.url)

Parameters

  • size –

  • width –

  • height –

ellipse(cx, cy, rx, ry, width=500, 'px', height=300, 'px', options=None)¶

SVG Ellipse - <ellipse>

Usage:

rptObj.ui.charts.svg.ellipse(100, 100, 40, 69)

https://www.w3schools.com/graphics/svg_ellipse.asp

Parameters

  • cx – The cx attribute defines the x coordinate of the center of the ellipse

  • cy – The cy attribute defines the y coordinate of the center of the ellipse

  • rx – The rx attribute defines the horizontal radius

  • ry – The ry attribute defines the vertical radius

  • width – Optional. Integer for the component width

  • height – Optional. Integer for the component height

  • options –

heart(w, h, fill='none', width=500, 'px', height=300, 'px')¶

c = rptObj.ui.charts.svg.heart(w=50, h=100, fill=”pink”) c[0].transform(“transform”, “rotate”, “0 100 100”, “360 100 10”)

Parameters

  • w –

  • h –

  • fill –

  • width –

  • height –

line(x1=0, y1=None, x2=None, y2=None, width=500, 'px', height=300, 'px', options=None)¶

Entry point to the basic line definition in a SVG HTML Tag

Usage:

rptObj.ui.charts.svg.line(10, 30, 40, 69)

https://www.w3schools.com/graphics/svg_line.asp

Parameters

  • x1 – The x1 attribute defines the start of the line on the x-axis

  • y1 – The y1 attribute defines the start of the line on the y-axis

  • x2 – The x2 attribute defines the end of the line on the x-axis

  • y2 – The y2 attribute defines the end of the line on the y-axis

  • width – Optional. Integer for the component width

  • height – Optional. Integer for the component height

  • options –

new(width=500, 'px', height=300, 'px')¶

SVG stands for Scalable Vector Graphics.

SVG defines vector-based graphics in XML format.

Usage:

svg = rptObj.ui.charts.svg.new(width=200)

svg.add_text(“I love SVG!”, x=0, y=15, options={“fill”: ‘red’})

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG https://www.w3schools.com/graphics/svg_intro.asp

Parameters

  • height – Optional. Integer for the component width

  • width – Optional. Integer for the component height

polygone(points, width=500, 'px', height=300, 'px', options=None)¶

Usage:

rptObj.ui.charts.svg.polygone([(15, 80), (29, 50), (43, 60), (57, 30), (71, 40), (85, 15)])

https://www.w3schools.com/graphics/tryit.asp?filename=trysvg_polygon

Parameters

  • points – The points attribute defines the list of points (pairs of x and y coordinates) required to draw the polyline

  • height –

  • width –

  • options –

  • points – The points attribute defines the list of points (pairs of x and y coordinates) required to draw the polyline
